text: <@U01QVR44MEY> Is there any endpoint to find a list of these special properties?
Hey! I want to have deal owner data when I send request to GET crm/v3/objects/deals/{dealId}. What property I should add to my query params to get that?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1681153038140289?thread_ts=1681129766.757939&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

Hi all,
I am trying to get form submission data with Postman through this reference <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/get-submissions-for-a-form>
Unfortunately, I got the message in response *Sorry, you have been blocked You are unable to access <http://hubapi.com|hubapi.com>*
but other APIs are working for me. please help me, anyone.
Yeah this is due to a DNS timeout, are you running this code in a CMS based serverless function? could you share your code?
You can add ?properties=HubSpot_owner_id and that will pull back the owner id but you'll then need to use the owners api to find the name and email for the owner
and is there a problem?
sorry I was editing the message

2 things I would be interested in checking,
1. what happens if you use RETURN_EXISTING instead.
2. Also what happens when you use the actual file import (not the url async one)
NP!
Thanks very much!
of course

Hey guys,

Hopefully an easy answer from someone here, does anyone know the Ring Central -> HubSpot integration and can give me some advice? Specifically, logging calls into the CRM.

I want to pass 'Number called' over with the existing integration, though can't seem to get an answer if it's possible or not. I believe it only passes call outcome, call type, contacted, associations and notes over. - So the number called value would need to be in the note body.

If it is not possible, how might I be able to do it? I'm currently thinking that I use the integration anyway to log the calls (the other features are handy for the team), and then pass the additional datapoint over separately. Would I be able to search for AND update the call activity using a UID?

Yes, I understand your reply but my question is how do I identify that the 'XYZ' field is a special field? Another example is the contact owner field, in the HubSpot app I can see some options but in the API response, there are no options. Hope you get my question.

Hi guys, good afternoon
Someone can help me to get some information about the users in HubSpot?
If is possible to get the login status? Like User X are logged, User Y are not logged
Using this endpoint i can’t get this information <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/account-activity-api>
Pass through a user id and check the top result, if it wasn't a log out I think the user would still be logged in
you would need to keep in mind the 24 no activity log out rule
So if the users are not logged in he is not in to the list?

If the user is not logged in either:
the first result will show he logged out,
or the first result will show he hasn't logged in for more than 24 hours which could mean that he's not still logged in
ok, so if these user are not logged now, but he logged today, will appear the last log from this user, so the information about logged out will appear after 24 hours right?

no so that api just shows logins and login attempts, so it's a little hard to do what you're trying to do because of the new 24 no activity log out that HubSpot has. Basically there's no way to tell if a user had activity in the last 24hr and is still logged in.
I think you can tell by using the externalOptions true or false
also fyi you can pull all the owners using the owners endpoint

hi! if i'm embedded multiple forms with different fields in a thinkific app and don't want the user to have to fill out their email on every form, can i require the email field on the first form and then hide it using HubSpot hidden form fields on the subsequent forms?
never mind, required fields can't be hidden, which makes sense

Hi Everyone.. I know that these APIs dont exist, but looking for ideas on how to solve these problems:
• I need to show a list of paid receipts/invoices/quotes in my webapp. There is no payments API, so any ideas on how to collect that info and show the list in my webapp?
• I need to show the end user the Subscription Renewal date. I dont see a subscriptions API, so any ideas on how to show that?
• Webhooks exist, but only for public apps? How do I update information in my system upon a successful payment in HubSpot, so that I can keep a users access turned on, limit them etc.
Thanks!
